content:
Meeting 2021-06-29T17:00:00+02:00

Agenda:

  • Triage
  • Stabilize cargo clippy --fix rust-clippy#7405
  • ...?
Meeting time :wave:
:wave:
hej hej!
• disallowed_script_idents https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/7400

This should be a really quick one:

  • With the sync on Thursday, we'll get the new clippy::suspicious group into nightly
  • We stabilized cargo clippy --fix

Do you have anything to discuss or any issues I should know of before the sync? @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
@Manish Goregaokar I haven't really followed the disallowed_script_idents PR, can you give a summary?
sure
so RFC 2457 (which i worked on) added non ascii idents to rust
i designed a number of carefully-put-together lints for it
using my unicode background and doing a bunch of research/spec reading

this PR wishes to add more lints that are stricter. the initial approach was something i'd rejected while designing the RFC because it would make a bad lint, but I managed to steer the discussion towards a restriction lint that works off of a config
but it's still kinda nuanced so having more eyes on it would be great
that's all

Yeah, I pinged you on the first PR, since I saw your name come up with the rustc lints, and also was really unsure about the first version.

Would you be inclined to accept the version in the new PR?

flip1995 said:

Do you have anything to discuss or any issues I should know of before the sync?

I think merging rust-clippy#7407 before the sync would be nice, as m-ou-se said that it's semi blocking #85746. I've requested some changes during the review, so it depends on when they get implemented, I guess
Oh yeah, I think both PRs by m-ou-se are worth getting in before the sync. Thanks for pointing that out!
@flip1995 yep, inclined to accept, also need to have more time to review and make sure it's good
but the new pr is in the right _shape_
@Manish Goregaokar Ok, I'll take a look at the disallowed_script_idents PR :+1: Since you have spent the most time on this topic it should ultimately be your decision what version gets merged.
Ok, that should be it for today then! Thanks for attending! :wave:
